item.title: Take Sakura as My Primary Terminal
item.author: 作者
item.description: It’s a long time since I came across rxvt-unicode. About seven years ago, when I switched from Windows XP to Ubuntu mainly for performance issues, I never be bored with searching for everything with a higher speed. To me, gnome-terminal is too much slow as a terminal being frequently opened and closed. Then, rxvt-unicode came through. At first glance, rxvt-unicode was so ugly that I put it behind without the
